file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 55-14-00-04 - HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT FAIRING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT FAIRING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the horizontal-stabilizer attachment fairing. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT ALL 55-14-00-000-801-A FAIRING - REMOVAL HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT ALL 55-14-00-400-801-A FAIRING - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 55-14-00 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 55-14-00-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT FAIRING - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the horizontal-stabilizer attachment fairing. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 335 Horizontal stabilizer 336 Horizontal stabilizer D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area available Commercially Torque wrench To remove the screws available Commercially Acrylic spatula To remove old sealant available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On stabilizer horizontal I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the PITCH TRIM 1 and 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (2) In the left electrical power control/distribution box, open the PITCH TRIM 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (3) In the right electrical power control/distribution box, open the PITCH TRIM 2 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (4) Put a DO-NOT-OPERATE-THE-HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER sign on the pitch trim panel, in the cockpit. J. Lower Fairing - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the screw (2). (2) Remove the lower fairing (1). (3) Remove the old aerodynamic sealant and prepare the surface. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (4) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. K. Lower Middle Fairing - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the screw (2). (2) Remove the fairing tip (1). (3) Remove the old aerodynamic sealant and prepare the surface. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (4) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL L. Upper Fairing - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) Remove the screws (2). (2) Remove the upper fairing (1). (3) Remove the old aerodynamic sealant and prepare the surface. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (4) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 4 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Horizontal-Stabilizer Attachment Fairing - Removal/Installation Figure 401 D A ZONES 335 336 C B DET. A 1 DET. F 1 E F DET. B 2. SCREW (5) DET. E 1. LOWER FAIRING 1. UPPER FAIRING 2. SCREW (5) F E E F DET. C 1. LOWER MIDDLE 2. SCREW (16) FAIRING DET. D 1 AERODYNAMIC SEALING 145AMM550014.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 5 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 55-14-00-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT FAIRING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the horizontal-stabilizer attachment fairing. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 335 Horizontal stabilizer 336 Horizontal stabilizer D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area available Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-083 Sealant, PR 2050 B-1/2 AR Commercially available Adhesive Tape AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Horizontal stabilizer I. Lower Fairing - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the lower fairing (1). Refer to (Figure 401); DET. B. (2) Install the screws (2) that attach the lower fairing (1) to the horizontal stabilizer. NOTE: For the torque, refer to AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (3) Apply aerodynamic sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. Refer to (Figure 401). NOTE: The sealant curing time changes with the environmental conditions. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. J. Lower Middle Fairing - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the lower middle fairing (1). Refer to (Figure 401); DET. C. (2) Install the screws (2) that attach the lower middle fairing (1) to the horizontal stabilizer. NOTE: For the torque, refer to AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (3) Apply aerodynamic sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. Refer to (Figure 401). NOTE: The sealant curing time changes with the environmental conditions. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. K. Upper Fairing - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-004-A (1) Install the upper fairing (1). Refer to (Figure 401); DET. D. (2) Install the screws (2) that attach the upper fairing (1) to the horizontal stabilizer. NOTE: For the torque, refer to AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (3) Apply aerodynamic sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. Refer to (Figure 401). NOTE: The sealant curing time changes with the environmental conditions. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. L. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the PITCH TRIM 1 and 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (2) In the left electrical power control/distribution box, close the PITCH TRIM 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) In the right power control/distribution box, close the PITCH TRIM 2 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (4) Remove the DO-NOT-OPERATE-THE-HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER sign from the pitch trim panel, in the cockpit. (5) Do the electrical-bonding test procedure as given in AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/ 200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-14-00 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
